snippet: Many residents marveled at how swiftly the rains had swamped their homes and carved up the mountainsides, transforming picturesque towns and vacation communities into scenes of devastation.
abstract: Thousands of Colorado residents are forced to evacuate their homes in face of rivers and streams choked by heavy rains, dirt and debris; four people have died in floods, and authorities say 80 people have been reported as unreachable or missing.

byline.original: By DAN FROSCH and JACK HEALY
byline.contributor: Dan Frosch reported from Longmont, and Jack Healy from Denver. Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Many residents marveled at how swiftly the rains had swamped their homes and carved up the mountainsides, transforming picturesque towns and vacation communities into scenes of devastation.

headline.main: Colorado Floodwaters Force Thousands to Flee
headline.print_headline: Colorado Floodwaters Force Thousands to Flee
